intro: Rhodiola bouvieri, commonly known as the Tibetan rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Rhodiola bouvieri is known for its ability to thrive in extreme conditions, making it a hardy species in alpine regions. Its botanical features include a low-growing rosette structure and a preference for full sun exposure.
